admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objectives of the Petroleum
            Exploration Project are the rekindling of interest of oil
            companies in exploration for oil and gas in the Philippines,
            and the extension of exploration activites to relatively
            unexplored onshore areas; strengthening the exploration
            capacity and technical capabilities of the two implementing
            entities is a further important objective. BED's
            proposed program consists of: (a) an aeromagnetic survey;
            (b) offshore seismic surveys; and (c) regional basin
            evaluations over 15 onshore and offshore areas integrating
            the newly acquired data. The results of this countrywide
            assessment of the petroleum prospects, which would highlight
            areas where immediate further exploration was warranted,
            would be assembled in the form of a promotional package
            available to any interested oil company. PNOC's
            proposed program comprises a step-wise exploration program
            in each of three or more onshore areas and includes: (a)
            gravity surveys and geological studies; (b) 4,400 line km of
            land seismic surveys; (c) drilling of 6 wells if warranted;
            and (d) technical assistance, training and seismic data reprocessing.
